instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message: hi, got a 280-3476-A with no liquid damage and reportedly never dropped. i got chime but no image (not backlight problem) not even on hdmi. after a while of being turned on the fan spins like crazy, i never had this behaviour before so what should i look for?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
Confirm to have USB activity; just to assure board is not stuck after chime...

"no image (not backlight problem)"
So you get backlight?
Black, or white screen then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
no backlight problem as no image at all, 

caps lock does not go green when pressed, external mouse light comes on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
Always better to check USB activity using USB OSX pendrive with link LED; if flashes, 100% board is booting.

Assuming USB activity, post voltages of J8300, pins 9 & 28-30.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
pin 9 0.24v without lcd conmected. 0v with lcd connected
pin 28/29/30 5v without lcd connected 1.8v with lcd connected

this with 2 different assemblies



blinking light on external hdd with osx installed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
Pins 28-30 should get 5v at least first few seconds (even without LCD), when power on the board.
At same time pin9 should go to 2.5V; 5V will drop if not.
Post voltage at both pins of L8300, with LCD connected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
L8300 1.79 v before and after with the lcd connected
pin9 0 volt with lcd connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
Post now <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> voltages.
If it gets 5V at pins 1 & 3 and 3V at pin 2, you should get 5V at pin 5 too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
"pin 28/29/30 5v without lcd connected"
Check that again.
Impossible to get 5V output if enable pin is low; unless <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> is bad.
Better to change <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message:
pin1 5,13v
pin2  0v
pin3 5,13v
pin5 1.78v
pin7 0v

yeah <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> probably dead

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message: bypassed it for testing and screen turn on. gonna order one. meanwhile i have to solve the crazy fan spin thing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message: installed one rom another board temporary and it works. does the fan go crazy if no trackpad is connected? because his own is extremely water damaged

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime no image, crazy fan spin
threads.message: Of course; palm rest sensor is not detected...
